intro: Acetosa usambarensis, commonly known as the Usambara catchfly, is a flowering plant native to the East African highlands. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its delicate, pinkish-purple flowers and hairy stems. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and rocky slopes. It has small, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. Acetosa usambarensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique adaptations to its mountainous habitat.
